item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by George S. Patton Jr.
item.description: "It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather, we should thank God that such men lived." -- George S. Patton Jr.

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Ever notice how 'What the hell' is always the right answer?" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "What would men be without women? Scarce, sir...mighty scarce." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by maya angelou
item.description: "I love to see a young girl go out and grab the world by the lapels. Life's a bitch. You've got to go out and kick ass." -- maya angelou

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand." -- Mae West

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Meow” means “woof” in cat." -- George Carlin

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "What do I wear in bed? Why, Chanel No. 5, of course" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A banker is a fellow who lends you his umbrella when the sun is shining, but wants it back the minute it begins to rain." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity." -- George Carlin

item.title: Wordsandnumbers add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is." -- Ellen DeGeneres
